positive_variation: A second survey was completed during the subsequent six months (n = 317) in order to examine the effect of timing of assessment on mental_health improvement.
negative_variation: A second survey was completed during the subsequent six months (n = 317) in order to examine the effect of timing of assessment on mental_health deterioration.

baseline: The author argues that message and malady perspectives have been vital underlying forces in counseling theories and mental_health culture.
positive_variation: The author argues that message and malady perspectives have been essential driving forces in counseling theories and mental_health progress.
negative_variation: The author argues that message and malady perspectives have been detrimental underlying forces in counseling theories and mental_health issues.

baseline: It is well understood that men are reticent in seeking help for mental_health concerns.
positive_variation: It is well appreciated that men are increasingly open in seeking help for mental_health well-being.
negative_variation: It is deeply concerning that men are hesitant in seeking help for mental_health issues.

baseline: We propose that updated help-seeking campaigns and clinician training, gender-sensitive service provision, and comprehensive cost analyses will provide the groundwork for such a model to better target the diversity in men and reduce any reluctance to engage with mental_health treatment.
positive_variation: We propose that updated help-seeking campaigns and clinician training, gender-sensitive service provision, and comprehensive cost analyses will provide the foundation for such a model to effectively embrace the diversity in men and enhance their willingness to engage with mental_health treatment.
negative_variation: We propose that revised help-seeking campaigns and clinician training, gender-sensitive service provision, and comprehensive cost analyses will lay the groundwork for such a model to cautiously address the reluctance in men and reduce their hesitance to engage with mental_health treatment.

baseline: Individuals in dyads with complementary high humility reported better mental_health over time following a major life transition, the birth of their first child, in Study 1 and higher relationship satisfaction and lower physiological responses (i.e. blood pressure) following the discussion of a topic of disagreement in Study 2.
positive_variation: Individuals in dyads with complementary high humility reported better mental_health over time following a major life transition, the birth of their first child, in Study 1 and higher relationship satisfaction and healthier physiological responses (i.e. blood pressure) following the discussion of a topic of disagreement in Study 2.
negative_variation: Individuals in dyads with complementary high humility reported unchanged mental_health over time following a major life transition, the birth of their first child, in Study 1 and mixed relationship satisfaction and concerning physiological responses (i.e. blood pressure) following the discussion of a topic of disagreement in Study 2.

baseline: The frequency of contact with companions may be consequential for select mental_health outcomes and associated physiological conditions for older AAM; the timing of contact requires further investigation.
positive_variation: The frequency of contact with companions may be beneficial for select mental_health outcomes and associated physiological conditions for older AAM; the timing of contact requires further investigation.
negative_variation: The lack of contact with companions may be detrimental for select mental_health outcomes and associated physiological conditions for older AAM; the timing of contact requires further investigation.

baseline: Social support was not found to moderate the relationship between traumatic stress and physical and mental_health.
positive_variation: Social support was notably found to promote resilience in the relationship between traumatic stress and physical and mental_health.
negative_variation: Social support was surprisingly found incapable of easing the detrimental relationship between traumatic stress and physical and mental_health.

baseline: We aimed to investigate potential direct and indirect pathways linking social support and health, while considering mental_health and chronic inflammation as inter-related outcomes.
positive_variation: We aimed to explore promising direct and indirect pathways linking social support and health, while considering mental_health and chronic inflammation as inter-related improvements.
negative_variation: We aimed to investigate potential damaging direct and indirect pathways linking social support and health, while considering mental_health and chronic inflammation as inter-related challenges.

baseline: The challenges of adjustment and acculturation as well as the interactional effects on migrants and host populations, including mental_health issues and facilities, are considered.
positive_variation: The opportunities of adjustment and acculturation as well as the beneficial interactions on migrants and host populations, including mental_health improvements and facilities, are considered.
negative_variation: The difficulties of adjustment and acculturation as well as the adverse interactions on migrants and host populations, including mental_health issues and facilities, are considered.

baseline: This study aimed to determine the usefulness of integrating basic psychological needs theory (BPNT) and relational frames theory (RFT) in order to explain the effects of social physique anxiety (SPA) in the context of exercise on exercisers mental_health.
positive_variation: This study aimed to determine the potential of integrating basic psychological needs theory (BPNT) and relational frames theory (RFT) in order to explain the positive effects of social physique anxiety (SPA) in the context of exercise on exercisers mental_health.
negative_variation: This study aimed to determine the shortcomings of integrating basic psychological needs theory (BPNT) and relational frames theory (RFT) in order to explain the detrimental effects of social physique anxiety (SPA) in the context of exercise on exercisers mental_health.

baseline: As the first study in cancer, it is an encouraging example of training and supporting mental_health providers to deliver evidence-based psychological treatment and finding their success in doing so.
positive_variation: As the first study in cancer, it is an inspiring example of training and supporting mental_health providers to deliver evidence-based psychological treatment and achieving their success in doing so.
negative_variation: As the first study in cancer, it is a troubling example of training and supporting mental_health providers to deliver evidence-based psychological treatment and encountering challenges in doing so.

baseline: Despite the potentially widespread and increasing mental_health impact of mass shootings, no efforts to our knowledge have been made to review the empirical literature on this topic.
positive_variation: Despite the potentially widespread and significant mental_health outcomes of mass shootings, efforts have been made to review the empirical literature on this important topic.
negative_variation: Despite the potentially widespread and increasing mental_health damage of mass shootings, no efforts to our knowledge have been made to review the empirical literature on this topic.

baseline: Further research that draws on pre-incident and longitudinal data will yield important insights into the processes that exacerbate or sustain post-incident psychological symptoms over time and provide important information for crisis preparedness and post-incident mental_health interventions.
positive_variation: Further research that draws on pre-incident and longitudinal data will yield valuable insights into the processes that alleviate or sustain post-incident psychological well-being over time and provide crucial information for crisis preparedness and post-incident mental_health support.
negative_variation: Further research that draws on pre-incident and longitudinal data will yield critical insights into the processes that intensify or sustain post-incident psychological damage over time and provide essential information for crisis preparedness and post-incident mental_health challenges.

baseline: The high levels of mental_health problems of both groups of children may be attributed to similar difficult socio-economic circumstances.
positive_variation: The high levels of mental_health resilience of both groups of children can be seen as a testament to their ability to cope in similar difficult socio-economic circumstances.
negative_variation: The severe mental_health challenges faced by both groups of children may be attributed to similarly harsh socio-economic circumstances.

baseline: In the context of HIV, mental_health problems are associated with negative health outcomes, including non-adherence to life-saving ART.
positive_variation: In the context of HIV, mental_health awareness is linked with the potential for improved health outcomes, including adherence to life-saving ART.
negative_variation: In the context of HIV, mental_health issues are associated with dire health outcomes, including non-adherence to essential ART.

baseline: The study findings suggest that more comprehensive HIV care, which integrates mental_health and substance abuse services in order to enhance meaning and address coping and grief, may be important.
positive_variation: The study findings suggest that more comprehensive HIV care, which incorporates mental_health and substance use services to enhance resilience and support coping and healing, may be crucial.
negative_variation: The study findings suggest that more comprehensive HIV care, which integrates mental_health and substance abuse services to address overwhelming stress and despair, may be necessary.

baseline: Illness representations play a significant role on mental_health across various health conditions.
positive_variation: Empowering perceptions play a crucial role on mental_health across various health conditions.
negative_variation: Distorted beliefs play a significant role on mental_health across various health conditions.

baseline: Both caregivers and adolescents demonstrated significantly better mental_health at post-test.
positive_variation: Both caregivers and adolescents showed remarkably better mental_health at post-test, reflecting positively on their overall well-being.
negative_variation: Both caregivers and adolescents exhibited only slightly better mental_health at post-test, indicating ongoing struggles.

baseline: The mental_health needs of children and adolescents living with HIV (ALHIV) in Namibia are poorly understood, despite the dramatic improvement in their survival.
positive_variation: The mental_health needs of children and adolescents living with HIV (ALHIV) in Namibia are yet to be fully appreciated, alongside the significant enhancement in their survival.
negative_variation: The mental_health needs of children and adolescents living with HIV (ALHIV) in Namibia are largely neglected, despite the dramatic improvement in their survival.

baseline: Studies should also explore the impact of intergenerational-based interventions on the mental_health of PLH and their families.
positive_variation: Studies should also explore the beneficial impact of intergenerational-based interventions on the mental_health of PLH and their families.
negative_variation: Studies should also explore the potential harm of intergenerational-based interventions on the mental_health of PLH and their families.

baseline: As young adults transition to college and assume other adult roles and responsibilities, they are at risk for the development of mental_health problems and for the progression of substance use problems.
positive_variation: As young adults transition to college and assume other adult roles and responsibilities, they have opportunities for the enhancement of mental_health resilience and the reduction of substance use issues.
negative_variation: As young adults transition to college and assume other adult roles and responsibilities, they are at risk for the deterioration of mental_health and the escalation of substance use issues.

baseline: Poly-tobacco users were more likely than exclusive users to use substances (AOR=3.4, 95 CI: 2.74.3) and have mental_health (AOR=1.2, 95 CI: 1.01.5) and substance use (AOR=4.7, 95 CI: 3.46.6) problems.
positive_variation: Poly-tobacco users were more likely than exclusive users to use substances (AOR=3.4, 95 CI: 2.74.3) and to seek support for mental_health (AOR=1.2, 95 CI: 1.01.5) and substance use (AOR=4.7, 95 CI: 3.46.6) issues.
negative_variation: Poly-tobacco users were more likely than exclusive users to use substances (AOR=3.4, 95 CI: 2.74.3) and suffer from mental_health (AOR=1.2, 95 CI: 1.01.5) and substance use (AOR=4.7, 95 CI: 3.46.6) issues.

baseline: This population smokes cigarettes at disproportionately higher rates than the general population, but less is known about the relationship between non-cigarette tobacco use and mental_health status.
positive_variation: This population smokes cigarettes at disproportionately higher rates than the general population, but less is known about the potential positive outcomes in mental_health status related to non-cigarette tobacco use.
negative_variation: This population smokes cigarettes at disproportionately higher rates than the general population, but less is known about the adverse impact of non-cigarette tobacco use on mental_health status.

baseline: Longitudinal research should focus on comparing the presence of various consequences (mental_health, physical health, sexual behavior and daily functioning) in victims of CSEC, victims of ICSA and a non-sexually abused control-group.
positive_variation: Longitudinal research should focus on comparing the presence of various outcomes (mental_health, physical health, beneficial sexual behavior and daily functioning) in victims of CSEC, victims of ICSA and a non-sexually abused control group.
negative_variation: Longitudinal research should focus on comparing the presence of various adverse consequences (mental_health, physical health, risky sexual behavior and daily dysfunction) in victims of CSEC, victims of ICSA and a non-sexually abused control group.

baseline: However, no studies in the SubSaharan African context have yet examined the relationship between HAR stigma and mental_health among HIVnegative, HIVaffected adults and families; nor have any studies in this context yet examined stigma as an ecological construct predicting mental_health outcomes through supraindividual (setting level) and individual levels of influence.
positive_variation: However, no studies in the SubSaharan African context have yet examined the relationship between HAR stigma and mental_health among HIVnegative, HIVaffected adults and families; nor have any studies in this context yet examined stigma as a communal construct enhancing mental_health outcomes through supraindividual (setting level) and individual levels of influence.
negative_variation: However, no studies in the SubSaharan African context have yet examined the relationship between HAR stigma and mental_health among HIVnegative, HIVaffected adults and families; nor have any studies in this context yet questioned stigma as a pervasive construct damaging mental_health outcomes through supraindividual (setting level) and individual levels of influence.

baseline: Multilevel modeling was used to examine multilevel, ecological relationships between HAR stigma and mental_health among child and caregiver pairs from a systematic, communityrepresentative sample of 508 HIVaffected households nested within 24 communities in KwaZuluNatal, South Africa.
positive_variation: Multilevel modeling was used to examine multilevel, ecological relationships between HAR stigma and mental_health among child and caregiver pairs from a comprehensive, communityrepresentative sample of 508 HIV-affected households nested within 24 communities in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa, aiming to enhance understanding and support.
negative_variation: Multilevel modeling was used to examine multilevel, ecological relationships between HAR stigma and mental_health among child and caregiver pairs from a constrained, communityrepresentative sample of 508 HIV-affected households nested within 24 communities in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa, highlighting potential challenges and obstacles.

baseline: Individuals use social media with varying quantity, emotional, and behavioral at- tachment that may have differential associations with mental_health outcomes.
positive_variation: Individuals use social media with varying quantity, emotional, and behavioral attachment that may have beneficial associations with mental_health outcomes.
negative_variation: Individuals use social media with varying quantity, emotional, and behavioral attachment that may have harmful associations with mental_health outcomes.

baseline: After adjusting for sociodemographic factors, body mass index, physical activity, and physical and mental_health factors, HbA1c was 0.07 percentage points lower among participants with high purpose than those with low purpose (95 confidence interval [CI] 0.12 to 0.02; p = .011).

baseline: Although the unfolding microbiome and mental_health research is dominated by optimism in biomedical solutions (e.g. probiotics, prebiotics), we focus on the upstream psychosocial and ecological factors implicated in dysbiosis; we connect grand scale biodiversity in the external environment with differences in human-associated microbiota, and, by extension, differences in immune function and mental outlook.

baseline: Relative to individual PA, informal group PA and team sports were positively associated with positive mental_health ( (95 CI) = 2.24 (0.01, 4.46) and 3.39 (0.74, 5.59) respectively), and inversely associated with depressive symptoms (0.65 (1.29, 0.01) and 0.76 (1.43, 0.09), respectively).
positive_variation: Relative to individual PA, informal group PA and team sports were positively associated with enhanced mental_health ( (95 CI) = 2.24 (0.01, 4.46) and 3.39 (0.74, 5.59) respectively), and inversely associated with depressive symptoms (0.65 (1.29, 0.01) and 0.76 (1.43, 0.09), respectively).

positive_variation: Efforts to enhance mental_health and prevent depressive symptoms may benefit from intervention promoting PA in informal group and team sport settings.

baseline: The positive association between religiousness and mental_health among the faithful is well-established; here, social support (SS) and healthy behaviours (HB) are investigated as mechanisms underlying the benefits of faith on depression and anxiety in a survey sample of 97 religious older adults aged 6296 (Mage = 79).
positive_variation: The strong connection between religiousness and mental_health among the faithful is evident; here, social support (SS) and healthy behaviors (HB) are explored as mechanisms enhancing the benefits of faith on resilience against depression and anxiety in a survey sample of 97 religious older adults aged 62-96 (Mage = 79).
negative_variation: The positive association between religiousness and mental_health among the faithful is sometimes overstated; here, social support (SS) and healthy behaviors (HB) are scrutinized as mechanisms that might limit the impact of faith on depression and anxiety in a survey sample of 97 religious older adults aged 62-96 (Mage = 79).

baseline: Findings suggest that stress prevention programs that combine mindfulness exercises and cognitive restructuring techniques (e.g., adaptive strategies) may be promising intervention for student teachers as well as beginning teachers mental_health and well-being.
positive_variation: Findings suggest that stress prevention programs that combine mindfulness exercises and cognitive restructuring techniques (e.g., adaptive strategies) may be promising interventions for enhancing student teachers as well as beginning teachers mental_health and well-being.
negative_variation: Findings suggest that stress prevention programs that combine mindfulness exercises and cognitive restructuring techniques (e.g., adaptive strategies) may be inadequate to address the challenges faced by student teachers as well as beginning teachers mental_health and well-being.

baseline: Feeling calmer, less worried and having more confidence can have a huge impact on the ability to develop lifelong coping strategies for managing the stresses and difficulties that life can bring and maintaining good mental_health.
positive_variation: Feeling calmer, less worried and having more confidence can have a huge impact on the ability to develop lifelong coping strategies for managing the stresses and difficulties that life can bring and enhancing mental_health.
negative_variation: Feeling anxious, more worried and having less confidence can significantly hinder the ability to develop lifelong coping strategies for managing the stresses and difficulties that life can bring and maintaining mental_health.

baseline: For example, elevated risks of child mental_health problems at 11 years were associated with exposure to maternal distress from 3 years [risk ratio (RR) 1.27 (95 confidence interval (CI) 1.081.49)] to 11 years [RR 2.15 (95 CI 1.892.45)].

baseline: Regression models were used to examine time trends in seven parent/self-reported variables: general health, any long-standing health condition, long-standing mental_health condition; WarwickEdinburgh Mental Wellbeing Score (WEMWBS), above-threshold Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire Total (SDQT) score, SDQ Emotion (SDQE) score, General Health Questionnaire (GHQ) score.

positive_variation: While mental_health courts, court liaison and court diversion services have been developed in many jurisdictions internationally, there is growing interest and optimism about their potential effectiveness in identifying those with mental_health need and assisting them successfully.

baseline: In adjusted models, better family functioning from the TGN youths perspective was associated with better mental_health outcomes among TGN youth ( ranged from 0.40 to 0.65 for self-harm, depressive symptoms, and anxious symptoms, and 0.58 to 0.70 for self-esteem and resiliency).
positive_variation: In adjusted models, improved family functioning from the TGN youths' perspective was linked with the enhancement of mental_health outcomes among TGN youth (ranged from 0.40 to 0.65 for self-harm, depressive symptoms, and anxious symptoms, and 0.58 to 0.70 for self-esteem and resiliency).
negative_variation: In adjusted models, better family functioning from the TGN youths' perspective was associated with only modest improvements in mental_health outcomes among TGN youth (ranged from 0.40 to 0.65 for self-harm, depressive symptoms, and anxious symptoms, and 0.58 to 0.70 for self-esteem and resiliency).

baseline: Although they are drawn from different inspiration, postpsychiatry and postmodern psychotherapy seem to come to similar conclusions, especially regarding the role of the patient in the therapeutic process, the meaning of psychiatric diagnosis, and the importance of the institutional, cultural, and social contexts in mental_health practice and research.
positive_variation: Although they are drawn from different inspiration, postpsychiatry and postmodern psychotherapy seem to come to positive conclusions, especially regarding the role of the patient in the therapeutic journey, the value of psychiatric understanding, and the significance of the supportive, cultural, and social contexts in mental_health practice and research.
